com.gmail.woodyc40.commons.providers

Class UnsafeProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gmail.woodyc40.commons.providers.UnsafeProvider

  • public final class UnsafeProvider
extends Object
    This provides a wrapper for Unsafe, which allows for low-level Java operations unsafely.

    Note that the starting method used to acquire the instance of Unsafe may throw two reflective exceptions caused by access restrictions to the instance field of Unsafe. The deeper cause of that may be the JVM used to run this. This is a HotSpot directed program.

    This class is not thread safe

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    AgentTroll
    See Also:
    getProvider(), Unsafe.getUnsafe()

    • Method Detail

      • getProvider

        public static sun.misc.Unsafe getProvider()
        Acquires the raw instance Unsafe "hacked" from the source.

        If an exception was thrown when this class was loaded, this method will most likely return null. JVM implementations may modify the field in which the instance of Unsafe is stored, throwing an exception when normal acquisition methods are applied.

        This is guaranteed to not return null on the HotSpot JVM

        Returns:
        the Unsafe instance received when this class was loaded.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Unsafe instance was not acquired already during load

      • fieldOffset0

        public static long fieldOffset0(Field field)
        Provides field offset calculations of a field in order to find its location in a class.

        The field parameter should never be null. An exception will be thrown if it is.

        Parameters:
        field - the field to return the offset of
        Returns:
        the relative class location offset of the field

      • fieldOffset

        public static long fieldOffset(Field field)
        Obtains the cached offset for the given field. This is almost 4 times faster than calculating each time at the cost of memory and thread safety.
        Parameters:
        field - the field to return the offset of
        Returns:
        the field offset

      • acquireField

        public static Object acquireField(Field field,
                                  Object holder)
        Acquires the raw field value of the specified field of a class.

        It may return null. This can happen under the following circumstances:

        • If the field value is null for the particular instance (More common).
        • If one of the parameters required to be non-null is null
        • Or if the field is not found or not able to be accessed. Check method call, spelling, and class source. Indicated by a thrown exception.

        The holder parameter may be null for static fields. In fact, it is set null for this purpose in the method itself, so it will not matter nevertheless.

        Parameters:
        holder - the instance of the object to acquire the value from.
        Returns:
        the value of the acquired field from the instance of the holder parameter
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a nullable parameter is null

      • setField

        public static void setField(Field field,
                            Object holder,
                            Object value)
        Sets the raw field value for the given field object in the class

        This method will fail under the following circumstances:

        • If one of the parameters required to be non-null is null
        • Or the field could not be found. Indicated by a thrown exception

        Parameters:
        field - the field to put the new value in
        holder - the instance of the object to set the field in
        value - the new value of the field

      • initClass

        public static <T> T initClass(Class<T> c)
        Instantiates a class without calling the constructor of the class

        This is EXTREMELY IMPORTANT - THIS METHOD WILL NOT CALL THE CLASS CONSTRUCTOR!

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of class instantiated, the type returned
        Parameters:
        c - the class to make a new instance of
        Returns:
        the new instance of the class passed in

      • monitor

        public static void monitor(boolean entry,
                           Object o)
        Forces current thread to acquire or release the monitor of an object.

        This is a very low level implementation, no checks will be performed to whether the monitor is already held by the current thread before execution.

        It is crucial to use this as an implementation or entry point to synchronization instead of a careless direct call. A monitor acquired with this method can only be released using: UnsafeProvider.monitor(false, object); where object is the object with its monitor held by the current thread.

        Parameters:
        entry - true to acquire the monitor, false to release.
        o - The object to acquire to release the monitor of.

      • compareAndSwap

        public static void compareAndSwap(Object instance,
                                  Field field,
                                  Object expect,
                                  Object nw)
        CAS operation, sets the field in an object to nw if expect is the current value.

        Note that this method performs a deep search for the field to swap.

        Parameters:
        instance - the object instance to acquire the field in
        field - the field to swap the value for
        expect - the expected value of the field
        nw - the value to set if expect is the current field value

      • sizeOf

        public static long sizeOf(Object object)
        Takes the shallow size of the object.

        Equivalent Java implementation of C sizeOf

        Is not an alternative for Instrumentation.getObjectSize(Object). Will not be as accurate as that method, this should only be used for programs where the EXACT size of an object in heap can have small inaccuracies.

        Parameters:
        object - the object to find the size of. Cannot be an array.
        Returns:
        the size of the object stored in its header in the JVM

      • castSuper

        public static <T> T castSuper(Object main,
                              T superclass)
        Makes an unsafe cast from main to a superclass without ClassCastException.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of superclass to cast to
        Parameters:
        main - the class to cast
        superclass - the class to cast main to
        Returns:
        the result of casting main to superclass

        Returns:
